thread.title: Central New York golf: CNY PGA seniors best their SDGA peers in Sovik Cup
thread.title_full: Central New York golf: CNY PGA seniors best their SDGA peers in Sovik Cup | syracuse.com

author: M.F. Piraino | Contributing writer
title: Central New York golf: CNY PGA seniors best their SDGA peers in Sovik Cup
text:
CNY PGA For the third straight year, players representing the Central New York PGA defeated the Syracuse District Golf Association team, 20-5, in the 29th annual Sovik Cup on Thursday at Tuscarora Golf Club.
The CNY PGA professionals won all five head-to-head matches against the SDGA senior amateurs. The Sovik tournament pits the area's best senior amateurs (ages 55-over) from the SDGA against professionals (50-over) from the CNY PGA.
Russ Schreiber, head pro at Onondaga Golf and Country Club, led all players with a 69, followed by Cazenovia Country Club pro Mark Tucker with a 70. Todd Dischinger led the SDGA seniors with a 71.
The CNY PGA leads the series 16-12-1.
CNY PGA 20, SDGA 5
Mark Tucker-Rick Bronson (CNY PGA) def. Stew McGough-Frank Plata, 4-1; Mel Baum-Kevin Savage (CNY PGA) def. Randy Young-Todd Dischinger, 3-2; Alan-Savage-Russ Schreiber (CNY PGA) def. Hank Fust-Rick Jones, 4 ½-1/2; Bruce Martins-Rick Keding (CNY PGA) def. Joe Oddo-Bruce Wilkie, 5-0; Robert Todd-Joe Tesori (CNY PGA) def. Phil Griffin-Mal Reardon, 3 ½-1 ½.
Leading scores: Schreiber 69, Tucker 70, A. Savage 71, Dischinger 71, Baum 72, Bronson 73, K. Savage 73, Jones 73.
